body_html:
It seems that the issue lies in _BatchSelfAdjointEigShape(op) in linalg_ops.py. In line 95 (from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.10/tensorflow/python/ops/linalg_ops.py), dlist[-2] += 1
also increments input_shape.dims (see line 94), causing the input dimensions to change. A deepcopy fixes the problem, but is again a hack solution.
body_text:
It seems that the issue lies in _BatchSelfAdjointEigShape(op) in linalg_ops.py. In line 95 (from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.10/tensorflow/python/ops/linalg_ops.py), dlist[-2] += 1
also increments input_shape.dims (see line 94), causing the input dimensions to change. A deepcopy fixes the problem, but is again a hack solution.
body:
It seems that the issue lies in _BatchSelfAdjointEigShape(op) in linalg_ops.py. In line 95 (from https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/r0.10/tensorflow/python/ops/linalg_ops.py), dlist[-2] += 1
also increments input_shape.dims (see line 94), causing the input dimensions to change. A deepcopy fixes the problem, but is again a hack solution.
